title: Caterpillar Second Quarter Sales Up 11%; The construction and mining equipment manufacturer says demand remains healthy across most end markets
text:
Chief Executive Jim Umpleby said Tuesday the results reflect healthy demand across most of the company's end markets.

For the three months ended June 30, Caterpillar reported a profit of $1.67 billion, or $3.13 a share, up from $1.41 billion, or $2.56 a share, a year earlier. Stripping out one-time items, adjusted second-quarter earnings were $3.18 a share, above analyst expectations of $3.01, according to FactSet.

Revenue rose to $14.25 billion from $12.89 billion in the year-earlier quarter. Analysts polled by FactSet anticipated revenue of $14.28 billion.

The company reported higher sales across its three primary divisions. In the company's construction unit, revenue rose 7% to $6.03 billion, and in its resource unit and energy and transportation unit sales rose 16% and 15% to $2.96 billion and $5.71 billion, respectively.

Its operating margin was down slightly in the period, to 13.6% from 13.9% a year earlier.

Caterpillar shares, down 5.8% this year through Monday, fell 3% in premarket trading.
